titles.title: Transparency in Rule Making When Using Scientific Testing Act of 2011
Transparency in Rule Making When Using Scientific Testing Act of 2011
To amend title 5, United States Code, to require that scientific studies used in a rule making be published, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Courts, Commercial and Administrative Law.

committee.name: House Judiciary

bill.summary: Transparency in Rule Making When Using Scientific Testing Act of 2011 - Requires the general notice of proposed rulemaking published in the Federal Register to include any scientific research of which the agency is aware and which is relevant to the rulemaking. Defines "scientific study" for purposes of the rulemaking process.
